conclusion: The p-V image of the change process of an ideal gas from state A to state B and then to state C is shown.
The temperature of the gas in state A is known to be 27 °C.
Find how much work is done externally by the gas from state B to state C.
From B to C the gas expands isobarically at 2 × 10⁵ Pa.
The volume increases from 2 × 10⁻³ m³ to 3 × 10⁻³ m³.

premise: The volume increases from 2 × 10⁻³ m³ to 3 × 10⁻³ m³.
conclusion: The change in volume is 1 × 10⁻³ m³.

premise: From B to C the gas expands isobarically at 2 × 10⁵ Pa and the change in volume is 1 × 10⁻³ m³.
conclusion: Work done by the gas: W = P ΔV = (2 × 10⁵ Pa)(1 × 10⁻³ m³) = 2 × 10² J = 200 J.

premise: Work done by the gas: W = P ΔV = (2 × 10⁵ Pa)(1 × 10⁻³ m³) = 2 × 10² J = 200 J.
